Description: Cast cuboid weight or ingot in lead; small/large cracks at each edge; fragmentary with all sides damaged; heavily corroded.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Town (Naukratis), House 93 (Petrie), a house on the East side of the excavated town
Dimensions: Weight: 265 grammes (weight loss difficult to assess)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Oriental Institute, University of Chicago. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (VB.224)
